block.l: Division by zero is not allowed.

custom-block.l: ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10
TypeError: list index out of range
TypeError: list index out of range

custom-block.comment: assign multiple variables: x, y, z = "Apple", "Banana", "Orange"
Data type: List The list is changeable, meaning that we can change, add, and remove items in a list after it has been created. and it allows Duplicate values.
Insert item in list by specified index
Extend List To append elements from another list to the current list
Remove specified item from List by given value
Delete specified item from List by index If no specify the index, it will removes the last item.
Replace item in List by index
Comparision Operator: Greater than or equal to
Comparision Operator: Less than or equal to
Arithmetic Operator: Exponentiation x = 2 y = 5 x ** y = 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2
Arithmetic Operator: Modulus x = 10 y = 2 x % y = 0.
The int() function is to confirm the input value is an integer number, otherwise an error will be returned.
The pow() function returns the value of x to the power of y (xy). x as the base y as the exponet x = 4 y = 3 pow(x,y) is 64 Return the value of 4 to the power of 3 (same as 4 * 4 * 4)

The pow() function returns the value of x to the power of y (x % y). x as the base y as the exponet z as the modulus x = 4 y = 3 z = 5 pow(x,y,z) is 4 Return the value of 4 to the power of 3, modulus 5 (same as (4 * 4 * 4) % 5)
Membership Operator: in Returns True if a sequence with the specified value is present in the object
Membership Operator: not in Returns True if a sequence with the specified value is not present in the object
The factorial of a non-negative integer n is the product of all positive integers less than or equal to n, denoted by n!. For example, 5! = 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x2 = 120
If a number is evenly divisible by 2 without any remainder, then it is an even number; Otherwise, it is an odd number. The modulo operator % is used to check it in such a way as num%2 == 0 .
Find_square(num): The function Find_square(num) takes a single argument and returns its square.

scripts.comment: Hybrid Python Project ★ put "Run" block for main frame (which will reset the stage) ★ then put put "python code" into "Run" block. ★ Use mouse click on the "Run" block to run the "python code" you do
